name: bamboo pole production | bamboo pole | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/30387/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of bamboo pole with a water content of u=16%. The data was obtained from information on the process of bamboo pole production provided during the visit in July 2022 at the facility "Unodec" (Portoviejo, EC). This facility can be seen as representative for the average EC production. ;Bamboo culms are usually trimmed to a size that allows them to be inserted into the preservation pond. It is assumed that the bamboo culms with a water content of 80% are used for the production of bamboo poles. The production takes place at a bamboo processing facility and includes the washing and treatment process. First, the culms are cleaned with a pressure washer. A solution of boric acid, borax and water is used to treat bamboo against fungi and pests. Residues of bamboo are used as firewood to heat up the treatment solution. Finally, bamboo poles are dried in the open air (therefore the infrastructure is not accounted for in this dataset), supported and interleaved on the two sides of a trestle in scissors position. To use bamboo poles in construction, their water content must be equal to or less than the equilibrium humidity of the site. In this case, for Portoviejo 16%.;Data collection was performed by Kristi Marcela Padrón Flasher, Monica Estefania Barros Bermeo, Jonnathan Patricio Aguirre Collahuazo and Juan Sebastian Martines Tola from the Inclusive Circular Economy and Sustainable Development Research Group (ECI) of the University of Cuenca (EC). This dataset was developed in the frame of the CEELA (Strengthening capacities for energy efficiency in buildings in Latin America) project with the support of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC). Some data was calculated using literature values. 

The activity starts with the culms being available at the processing facility. The transport to the processing facility is not included.

This activity ends with the production of bamboo poles at the processing facility. The dataset includes the inputs associated with the washing treatment. Infrastructure and transport are not included, as well as losses of boric acid and borax. The latter are not expected to be significant.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/162:Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period referring to the data source: 2010-2023. Based on expert opinion data is considered to be valid at least up to 2028.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current production technology representative in Ecuador. Bamboo forestry experts in Ecuador, Juan Carlos Salazar, agricultural engineer and Fabian Moreno, project manager of the International Bamboo and Rattan Organization (INBAR) Ecuador confirmed that the use of electric instruments for sawing is not very usual in preservation centers, where bamboo poles are produced. According to Fabian Moreno machinery will be introduced in the production process in the future due to the demand for good quality bamboo poles. The culm’s perforation is done with a long steel rod. This process allows the entry of the preservation solution (Morán, 2009). ;;Reference:;Morán, J. (2009). Construir con Guadua: Manual de construcción (Vol. 2, pp. 13–17). INBAR. https://bambuecuador.files.wordpress.com/2018/01/2009-construir-con-guadua-manual-de-construccic3b3n.pdf
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data were gathered in a bamboo pole factory located in Portoviejo, Ecuador, through a process assessment in a technical visit. The data from the facility visited can be seen as representative for the average EC production.

exchanges.description: This datatset represents the production of 1 kg of bamboo pole. One bamboo pole has an average weight of 18 kg, and average dimensions of 6 meters (length)  x 11 cm (diameter).

flow.name: bamboo pole
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/162:Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Some of the bamboo residues which are produced as a by-product are used as internal fuel for the required heat input for the drying process. Emissions for the combustion of bamboo residues are approximated with the combustion of wood chips using the dataset “heat production, softwood chips from forest, at furnace 300kW”. It is assumed that per kg of bamboo pole, 0.066 kg of waste bamboo residues [kg of dry mass] are burned as fuel.

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Value calculated through mass balance. The value refers to the by-product of trimming processes to obtain exact dimensions when needed. It is considered here that all residues are burned or used as firewood to prepare the pole treatment solution. In reality, however, they are also donated to make handicrafts.

flow.name: Formaldehyde
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. This represents the amount of water that flows onto the ground after washing bamboo culms with the pressure washer. It is assumed that 80% of the water is emitted to groundwater and 20 % to surface water. 

Reference:
Gmünder S., Rubio L., Kounina A., Bunge J., Conza A., Soni H., Notten P., (2019). Life Cycle Inventories of Water Supply and Distribution. ecoinvent Association, Zürich, Switzerland

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/ground water

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Some of the bamboo residues which are produced as a by-product are used as internal fuel for the required heat input for the drying process. flow.name: Bromine
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Refers to the electricity consumed by the pressure water pump, used to clean bamboo culms before the preservation process. It is calculated considering that in one month 600 poles of 18kg each are washed, the monthly energy cost is 15USD and the energy price 0.1031 USD/kWh.

flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

flow.name: Acetaldehyde
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Amount of borax used to prepare the treatment solution of the poles. The treatment solution is kept in a pool where the poles are submerged, once the treatment is finished the poles are extracted and the solution is recovered. The value is calculated considering that 25kg/m3 borax is used in a 13 m3 pool. Each pole absorbs 3L of solution, which means that with 13m3 water (13000L) in a pool approx. 433 pole can be treated -> (25 kg/pool)/ (433 poles/pool) * (poles/18 kg)

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Some of the bamboo residues which are produced as a by-product are used as internal fuel for the required heat input for the drying process. Emissions for the combustion of bamboo residues are approximated with the combustion of wood chips using the dataset “heat production, softwood chips from forest, at furnace 300kW”. It is assumed that per kg of bamboo pole, 0.066 kg of waste bamboo residues [kg of dry mass] are burned as fuel.
